com.justai.zenbox.sdk

Class ZenboxService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.justai.zenbox.sdk.ZenboxService

  • public final class ZenboxService
extends java.lang.Object
    The ZenboxService class contains the logic of Zenbox service and method for it's lifecycle control. All these methods are used internally by ZenboxService but can be used from outside of it if this is necessary by the logic of your application. ZenboxService class should be instantiated through the ZenboxService.Builder builder. This class is stateful. The current state can be obtained through the getState() method and ZenboxListener.onStateChanged(State) callback.
    See Also:
    State, ZenboxService.Builder, Utterance, ZenboxListener, SpeechToText, TextToSpeech, VoiceTrigger

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ZenboxService.Builder
      The Builder class contains methods to build a new instance of ZenboxService.

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        public State getState()
        The current state of this ZenboxService.
        Returns:
        the current state
        See Also:
        State

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys this instance and releases all used resources as well as each added skill. Should be invoked once before terminating of your application.

      • standby

        public void standby()
        Stops the current operation and changes the status to STANDBY.

      • toggleRecognition

        public void toggleRecognition()
        Starts or stops recognition regarding the current state of this ZenboxService instance.
        See Also:
        State

      • startRecognition

        public void startRecognition()
        Stops the current operation starts the speech-to-text recognition.

      • stopRecognition

        public void stopRecognition()
        Stops the speech-to-text recognition. SpeechToTextListener.onSpeechResult(String) will be invoked with recognition results.

      • cancelRecognition

        public void cancelRecognition()
        Interrupts the speech-to-text recognition. SpeechToTextListener.onSpeechResult(String) won't be invoked. The ZenboxService goes to STANDBY state.

      • speak

        public void speak(Utterance utterance)
        Starts the text-to-speech synthesise process.
        Parameters:
        utterance - utterance to synthesise
        See Also:
        Utterance

      • stopSpeaking

        public void stopSpeaking()
        Stops the text-to-speech synthesise. TextToSpeechListener.onUtteranceComplete(Utterance) won't be invoked. The ZenboxService goes to STANDBY state.

      • processRequest

        public void processRequest(java.lang.String query)
        Sends the user's query to Zenbox. This method is not blocking and can be used on the main thread.
        Parameters:
        query - user's request query
